name: Augustus Loop
description: Augustus Loop is a disting NT implementation of one of Expert Sleepers' oldest products, the VST plug-in of the same name. Essentially, it's a tape-inspired stereo delay with adjustable parameters for time, feedback, routing, and effects. The algorithm features four independent 'tape read heads', allowing for various delay configurations like straight stereo delays or ping-pong delays. It supports manual delay adjustment, tap tempo, clock input, CV control of tape speed (scaled 1V/octave), tape stop/reverse functionality, an effects loop for external processing, and a saturation/filter section. The module also includes advanced features such as inertia-free mode, bit depth selection, and detailed routing options.
short_description: Tape-like delay with stereo feedback paths, CV control, effects loop, and saturation/filtering.
use_cases: External effects processing via FX loop
Saturation and filtering for warm tones
gui_description: The GUI displays feedback amount at the bottom left, delay time at the bottom right, and an animated center area indicating tape direction/speed. Clock pulses flash 'Clock', and tap tempo readiness shows as 'Tap'.
